# c4ptur3-th3-fl4g 

[Link to room](https://tryhackme.com/room/c4ptur3th3fl4g)

## Tools:
1. [CyberChef](https://gchq.github.io/CyberChef/)
2. [Morse Code Translator](https://morsecode.world/international/translator.html)
3. [Spectral Analysis](https://www.dcode.fr/spectral-analysis)

## Task 1: Translation & Shifting

Translate, shift and decode the following;
Answers are all case sensitive.

### 1. c4n y0u c4p7u23 7h3 f149?

> can you capture the flag?

### 2. 01101100 01100101 01110100 01110011 00100000 01110100 01110010 01111001 00100000 01110011 01101111 01101101 01100101 00100000 01100010 01101001 01101110 01100001 01110010 01111001 00100000 01101111 01110101 01110100 00100001

Using CyberChef, we can immediately get the answer. Just click on the magic wand. 

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/1b4130ac-a8e6-4662-830c-ebf47ea6bf9d)

> lets try some binary out!

### 3. MJQXGZJTGIQGS4ZAON2XAZLSEBRW63LNN5XCA2LOEBBVIRRHOM======

Using CyberChef, we can immediately get the answer. Just click on the magic wand. 

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/8086d37b-fe2a-40d0-a0c9-a9f1ece90f80)

> base32 is super common in CTF's

### 4. RWFjaCBCYXNlNjQgZGlnaXQgcmVwcmVzZW50cyBleGFjdGx5IDYgYml0cyBvZiBkYXRhLg==

Using CyberChef, we can immediately get the answer. Just click on the magic wand. 

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/72fd9e95-4acc-46f1-b1cd-e223e0d4c96b)

> Each Base64 digit represents exactly 6 bits of data.

### 5. 68 65 78 61 64 65 63 69 6d 61 6c 20 6f 72 20 62 61 73 65 31 36 3f

Using CyberChef, we can immediately get the answer. Just click on the magic wand. 

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/72a9b9a9-44f5-4067-9cf6-ed7257edbfe1)

> hexadecimal or base16?

### 6. Ebgngr zr 13 cynprf!

Using CyberChef, choose ROT13 as the recipe and we will get the answer. 

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/d44e8f39-e093-4ecc-a25f-bdcdaf87eaa7)

> Rotate me 13 places!

### 7. *@F DA:? >6 C:89E C@F?5 323J C:89E C@F?5 Wcf E:>6DX

Using CyberChef, choose ROT47 as the recipe and we will get the answer. 

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/14905119-aa9c-486f-b0eb-b947780b87a8)

> You spin me right round baby right round (47 times)

### 8. - . .-.. . -.-. --- -- -- ..- -. .. -.-. .- - .. --- -. . -. -.-. --- -.. .. -. --.

This is a morse code. Hence, let's use a Morse Code translator to decode it.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/d17a3499-9926-4cb8-b558-6412049140a1)

> TELECOMMUNICATIONENCODING

### 9. 85 110 112 97 99 107 32 116 104 105 115 32 66 67 68

Using CyberChef, we can immediately get the answer. Just click on the magic wand. 

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/801e06a7-88a5-49f0-9a91-1b763c1bd732)

> Unpack this BCD

### 10. 

Using CyberChef, click on the magic wand to decrypt using Base64 and Morse Code first.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/c361cda8-cdb4-465f-b85d-bb3c47a961cb)

```
01100110 01100101 00100000 01100000 01011111 01100000 00100000 01100000 01100000 01100101 00100000 01100010 01101000 00100000 01100000 01100000 01100100 00100000 01100010 01100001 00100000 01100000 01011111 01101000 00100000 01101000 01100110 00100000 01100000 01011111 01100110 00100000 01100000 01011111 01100000 00100000 01100010 01100001 00100000 01100000 01100000 01100101 00100000 01100000 01011111 01100011 00100000 01100000 01011111 01100100 00100000 01100000 01100000 01100100 00100000 01100010 01100001 00100000 01101000 01100110 00100000 01100010 01100001 00100000 01101000 01100111 00100000 01100000 01011111 01100100 00100000 01100000 01100000 01100101 00100000 01100010 01100001 00100000 01100000 01100000 01100101 00100000 01100000 01100000 01100011 00100000 01100000 01011111 01100100 00100000 01101000 01101000 00100000 01100000 01011111 01100110 00100000 01100000 01011111 01100100 00100000 01100000 01011111 01100000 00100000 01100000 01100000 01100011 00100000 01100011 01100101 00100000 01100011 01100101 00100000 01100011 01100101
```

The output seems like binary, so we will add "From Binary" into the recipe.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/2ed74541-65e7-4c53-ab97-1fd108d7cce7)

The output seems encrypted using a rotation cipher. Let's use ROT47 to decrypt it.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/4fed99a3-5909-4560-a850-855d89f6188a)

Finally, click on the magic wand to get the final message.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/ac27760e-7330-4197-86c6-c768efbba460)

Base64 > Morse Code > Binary > ROT47 > Decimal

> Let's make this a bit trickier...

## Task 2. Spectrograms

A spectrogram is a visual representation of the spectrum of frequencies of a signal as it varies with time. When applied to an audio signal, spectrograms are sometimes called sonographs, voiceprints, or voicegrams. When the data is represented in a 3D plot they may be called waterfalls. 

First thing first, download the task files. We will get a WAV audio file. Upload that for Spectral Analysis to get the flag.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/e63ffac6-8045-4a28-b23a-77bfe621b41b)

> Super Secret Message

## Task 3. Steganography

Steganography is the practice of concealing a file, message, image, or video within another file, message, image, or video.

Download the task files. We will get a jpeg image file. As the question suggest, we will use `steghide` from Kali to obtain the flag.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/6976547f-0576-4be7-9853-3425ed605ffe)

> SpaghettiSteg

## Task 4. Security through obscurity

Security through obscurity is the reliance in security engineering on the secrecy of the design or implementation as the main method of providing security for a system or component of a system.

### 1. Download and get 'inside' the file. What is the first filename & extension?

Using `binwalk -e meme.jpg`, we can get some additional files from the jpg image.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/55b721b1-f61c-4fbc-9c68-f67cd3a48f88)

From the additional files we got, we can get the answer to this question.

![image](https://github.com/ivanloh1216/TryHackMe/assets/58873811/289b8d29-18a7-46ba-8ec1-a3c00f4593ef)

> hackerchat.png

### 2. Get inside the archive and inspect the file carefully. Find the hidden text.

Using `strings hackerchat.png`, we can obtain the answer.

